abstract.t: This document specifies the translation mechanism mapping IPv6 address with 128 bits to the Adaptation Identifier (AID) with shorter length. When a device in IEEE802.15.4 domain needs to communicate with other nodes in IPv6 domain, it should acquire source AID and destination AID corresponding to source IPv6 address and destination IPv6 address, respectively from an IPv6 translation-capable gateway. The device will send packets using those AIDs to the gateway, and then the gateway will translate them to normal IPv6 addresses.
